Texts.Chs:
事故报告#14590

实验室确认J-11样本失踪。我们都相当困惑———即使它真的从太空舱里逃出来了，也必须有人关闭安全系统才能打开舱门让它逃走。我个人可以解释那天晚上每个人的不在场证明，因为他们都出席了寿司鉴赏活动。
Texts.Eng:
INCIDENT REPORT #14590

Specimen J-11 has been confirmed missing from the lab. We're all fairly puzzled - even if it did break out of its capsule, someone had to have deactivated the security system in order to open the doors for it to escape. I can personally account for everyone with the security codes that night, as they were all at the sushi-appreciation event.

Texts.Chs: 说实话，我很高兴这不再是我们的问题了。J-11相当令人不安——我知道一些研究同事声称它一直在发展某种形式的智慧，但我们都知道那是胡说八道。高级管理人员向我们保证，他们将处理这个问题，并让我们继续工作。我倾向于同意。
Texts.Eng: To be honest, I'm kind of glad it's no longer our problem. J-11 was rather unnerving - I know some of the research associates claim it had been developing some form of sapience, but we all know that's nonsense. Senior management has assured us that they'll deal with the problem, and to get on with our work. I'm inclined to agree.

Texts.Chs: 我们还不能确定它的确切位置，但是所有的迹象都显示它逃往了一个游乐园。我不认为J-11会以任何方式回到设施，所以只需要注销即可——一旦不可避免的问题发生，我就让那些保护团的空想社会改良家们来处理这个问题。
Texts.Eng: We haven't been able to pinpoint its exact location, but all signs appear to point to it escaping towards, for some reason, an amusement park. I don't think J-11 is traceable back to us in any way, so it's just a write-off - I'll just let those protectorate do-gooders take care of the problem once the inevitable starts.
